channel.title: Cant boot
channel.description:
Yeah..
I start up my EEE PC 701 and it says the "$HOME" directory is out of space..
I have it as a letter drive on my windows machine and it also says full..
I can view the files/folders on my DESKTOP but I can't transfer any or delete any..
Is there any way I can delete some files WITHOUT formatting? (I've had to format my eeepc due to boot loops MANY times in the past.. This time, it lasted me about 5 months..)

item.title: Cant boot
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:308190”]Does anyone else see the irony in the OP’s username and the subject of the thread?

You can boot a livecd (or in this case, since you don’t have a CD drive (unless you have an external one), you can boot a livecd from a USB stick) and simply delete some files from the hard drive.

Or you could take out the hard drive (or SSD, same thing) and put it in another computer (would probably have to have linux on it) to delete some files.[/quote]Ya, After I posted and actually read what it said (my friend wanted me to post for him). I saw the irony in it, hoping no one would notice >.>…

Read full topic

item.title: Cant boot
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Does anyone else see the irony in the OP’s username and the subject of the thread?

You can boot a livecd (or in this case, since you don’t have a CD drive (unless you have an external one), you can boot a livecd from a USB stick) and simply delete some files from the hard drive.

Or you could take out the hard drive (or SSD, same thing) and put it in another computer (would probably have to have linux on it) to delete some files.

Read full topic

item.title: Cant boot
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:4, topic:308190”][quote author=Starting up … link=topic=404322.msg2992837#msg2992837 date=1255387571]
its a laptop not a hdd…
[/quote]
wat.[/quote]

He means it a SSD. Which is practically the same as a HDD in this situation. Just format it. So much easier and would save everyones time. (except yours)

Read full topic
